Name: pentaerythritol production in sodium hydroxide solution | sodium formate | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Penta is produced industrially by reacting formaldehyde with acetaldehyde at 15 – 45 °C in the presence of aqueous calcium hydroxide or sodium hydroxide, according to the following reaction:;3 HCHO + H3C-CHO -> C5H12O4;Generally, a fourfold surplus of formaldehyde is used in order to minimize the production of dipentaerythritol.;There are no competing routes for the production of penta. Production information is confidential.;Reference:;Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. Final report ecoinvent data v2.0 No. 8. Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
